description:
Demolition and redevelopment of 51-55 Chenies Mews with a
building on basement, ground and three upper floors, plus
set back plant enclosure at fourth floor level, in
association with part refurbishment and part rebuilding of
57-67 Chenies Mews, [also on part basement, ground, and
three upper floors (all existing) with new set back plant
room and plant enclosures at fourth floor level] all in
connection with the provision of laboratories, consulting
rooms and administrative offices (Class D1) for occupation
by clinical departments within University College Hospitals
NHS Trust,
as shown on drawing numbers and documents in schedule dated
10.8.01.
decision_conditions:
Condition : 1 - The details of the elevations and facing materials to be
    used on the building shall not be otherwise than as shall
    have been submitted to and approved by the Council before
    the relevant part of the work on the site is commenced.  The
    package to be submitted shall include details of the
    aluminium framing section at 1:1 and more detailed
    elevational drawings at 1:50 and detailed sections of
    elevational detail at 1:10.

Condition : 2 - 2. Prior to the installation of any plant, a fully detailed
    background measurement (LA90), expressed in dB(A) when all
    plant/equipment are in operation. Where it is anticipated
    that any plant/equipment will have a noise that has a
    distinguishable, discrete continuous note (whine, hiss,
    screech, hum) and/or if there are distinct impulses (bangs,
    clicks, clatters, thumps) special attention should be given
    to reducing the noise levels from that piece of plant/
    equipment at any sensitive faï¿½ade to at least 10dB(A) below
    the LA90, expressed in dB(A).  For the purposes of this
    development, the background noise levels shall be taken as
    acoustic report (which should preferably be in the
    46dB(A)LA90, unless agreed otherwise by the local planning
    authority.
    (b) For each of the octave band of centre frequencies 63Hz-
    8KHz inclusive, noise levels from all plant/equipment
    (measured in LAeq) when in operation shall at all times add
    not more than 1 decibel to the existing background noise
    level LA90, expressed in dB(A), in the same octave band as
    measured 1 metre external to sensitive facades.
    (c) The acoustic report shall specify the hours of operation
    for each piece of equipment / machinery.  Automatic time
    recommended format, attached) shall be submitted to and
    clocks shall be fitted to all the equipment / machinery
    which is to be approved to operate for time limited hours,
    prior to commencement of the use of the units.  The timer
    equipment shall be properly maintained and retained
    permanently thereafter.
    (d) Before use commences, all plant and machinery shall be
    sound attenuated and isolated from the structure in
    accordance with a scheme set out in the detailed acoustic
    report and approved by the Council, such that the use can be
    carried out without detriment to the amenity of adjoining or
    approved by the local pla

Condition : 3 - Prior to the installation of any plant and ducting, a fully
    this condition.
    detailed separate report giving full specifications of the
    scheme for the treatment and extraction of fumes from the
    premises shall be submitted to and approved by the local
    planning authority.  It shall demonstrate that the plant is
    capable of extracting fumes to the appropriate height, in
    accordance with the relevant statutory controls for such
    emissions.  The development shall not be carried out
    otherwise than in accordance with any approval given under

Condition : 4 - To ensure that the Council may be satisfied with the
    external appearance of the building in accordance with the
    requirements of policies EN1, EN13 and EN31 of the London
    Borough of Camden Unitary Development Plan 2000.

Condition : 5 - To safeguard the amenities of the occupiers of the adjoining
    premises and the area generally in accordance with the
    requirements of policies RE2, EN5, EN6, DS1 and DS6 of the
    London Borough of Camden Unitary Development Plan 2000.

Condition : 6 - To safeguard the amenities of the occupiers of the adjoining
    premises and the area generally in accordance with the
    requirements of policies RE2, EN5, EN6, DS1 and DS6 of the
    London Borough of Camden Unitary Development Plan 2000.

Condition : 7 - The details required pursuant to Conditions 1,2 and 3 shall
    be submitted with the attached approval of details
    application form together with 5 sets of drawings or
    documents, one set of samples of material as appropriate and
    any other supporting information.

Condition : 8 - In good time, prior to the start of  the demolition and
    construction on site, the contractor shall discuss and agree
    with the Council's Streets Management Traffic Management
    Section (tel: 020-7974 5629) detailed arrangements for the
    transportation of goods and materials to and from the site.
    The Council will prosecute those responsible for any
    breaches of the provisions of the Highways and Litter Acts
    which occur as a result of construction on the site.

Condition : 9 - Noise from demolition and construction works is subject to
    the contractors and subcontractors comply at all times with
    the guidelines set out in the Council's Considerate
    Contractor Manual.
    control under the Control of Pollution Act 1974. You are
    advised to consult the Council's Environment and Consumer
    Protection Service Pollution Team, Camden Town Hall, Argyle
    Street, WC1H 8EQ, (tel: 020-7278 4444), or to seek prior
    approval under Section 61 if you anticipate any difficulty
    in carrying out construction other than within normal
    working hours and by means that would minimise disturbance
    to adjoining premises. In any event you should ensure that

Condition : 10 - You are required to publicise at all times during the
    in writing within three days of receipt of the complaint.
    construction process, on a noticeboard at the site, a
    contact telephone number and address for the manager of the
    construction process for use by local residents and
    businesses who have concerns arising directly from the
    construction process.  Out of working hours, there shall be
    an answering service on this telephone number.  All
    enquiries shall be responded to by telephone within one
    working day of the complaint or concern from the public, or

Condition : 11 - The development hereby approved may be subject to the
    Executive Infoline (tel.0514 545500).
    Construction (Design and Management) Regulations 1994 which
    govern health and safety through all stages of a
    construction project. The Regulations require clients  (ie.
    those, including developers, who commission construction
    projects) to appoint a planning supervisor and principal
    contractor who are competent and adequately resourced to
    carry out their health and safety responsibilities. Further
    information is available from the Health and Safety

Condition : 12 - Works of construction and ancillary activity should not take
    place other than between the hours of 0800 to 1800 on Monday
    to Friday, and the hours of 0800 to 1300 on Saturday, with
    no working on Sunday or Bank Holidays, in order to comply
    with locally enforced standards.

Condition : 13 - The arrangements for the storage of refuse and solid waste
    disposal of refuse.
    may be subject to control under the Building Regulations,
    and you are advised to consult the Council's Streets
    Management, Building Control Service, Camden Town Hall,
    Argyle Street  WC1H 8EQ, (tel: 020-7974 6100).  Your
    attention is also drawn to the need to consult the Council's
    Environment & Consumer Protection Service, Waste Management
    Team, Town Hall, Argyle Street entrance, Euston Road, WC1H
    8EQ, (tel: 020-7278 4444) regarding arrangements for the

Condition : 14 - If a revision to the postal address becomes necessary as a
    result of this development, application under Part 2 of the
    London Building Acts (Amendment) Act 1939 should be made to
    the Council's Records and Information Service, Environment
    Department (Street Naming & Numbering) Camden Town Hall,
    Argyle Street, WC1H 8EQ (tel: 020-7974 5613) prior to the
    completion of the development.

Condition : 15 - The correct street number or number and name must be
    displayed permanently on the premises in accordance with
    regulations made under Section 12 of the London Building
    (Amendments) Act 1939.
